reviewText:
I actually barely have words for this game.
You know what, ♥♥♥♥ that, I have tons of words.
First off, ♥♥♥♥ this game.
Second off, ♥♥♥♥ this game.
This game is made in Unity. What the ♥♥♥♥, man?
The game physics are practically non existant. The game mechanics are unlike anything I've ever seen. It's actually horrible, oh man, time to dodge more bear traps and lasers. The traps aren't fun or engaging or innovative, it's the same BORING REHASHED ♥♥♥♥ over and over. Oh look, MORE BEAR TRAPS.
The voice acting is terrible (and russian, go figure.)
This game isn't even worth 3.00 dollars. This game isn't even worth $0.50.
I would ACTUALLY rather play bad rats. This is just torture. MORE BEAR TRAPS.
The CIA should force guantanamo bay inmates to play this game to extract information. They'll be begging to snitch in 10 minutes or your money back, guaranteed. MORE BEAR TRAPS. MORE LASERS.

Overall I gave it a 9/510

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JdVsGjz9eIk&feature=gp-n-y&google_comment_id=z12ucx1jzvywhrx3l221udsjezekulmyg04

This is literally the worst game I have ever played. The worst. There are no worse games.

I can excuse the poor translations, the questionable framerates, the graphics...but this game simply is impossible to beat. It cannot be done.

I spend AN HOUR WITH THIS GAME. So you can thank me later. I spent an hour with this game and I could not progress past that point. Though really, you can reach that point in about...maybe fifteen minutes, probably less. Ten? Just depends on how good you are at avoiding instakill laser traps" and bear traps. Lots of bear traps. And lasers. And bear traps.

Which is kind of hard to do considering your character sort of wobbles around like a Teletubby on a Skittles binge. You sway side to side and step on things you didn't think you would step on.

I got to a section where you have to jump from platform to platform to advance
date: but the mouse button that makes you jump only seems to activate at random
recommended: meaning that you will simply walk forwards without jumping into the black abyss only to respawn at the beginning platform (without even the coutesy of having your joke of a stamina meter recharge).\n\nIt was an exercise in futility. This game doesn't work. Steam refunds
hoursPlayed: you are my Jesus.\n\nTo hell with this game. I saw guns in the video
voteText:
but I never made it that far. I at least wanted to get to the part with guns. I wanted to at least get three bucks worth of lulz out of this game.

But no. No such lulz were had.

To hell with Unknown Battle."

reviewText:
I bought this for hilarity, and a YouTube video.

Expected to shoot some things, have some lulz, the end, because hey, it's only £2.

Instead I got traps with varying hit detection depending on what the game felt like, and a jumping puzzle maze that only lady luck will allow you to finish. Seriously. It's so simple, and yet after nearly two hours, I still haven't been able to get through it because sometimes you will just not jump at all, no matter how hard you smash your spacebar. Also, don't be fooled by the Load" option on the main screen

reviewText:
This game is dogshit.  I'm glad I got it free and so happy I did not buy it.  My goodness the maximum resolution is 1280 x 1024 which made the everything seem awkward looking.  This is a first person platforming game and you control a character wherein in order for you finish a level you must try to avoid different bear traps, lasers and what not blocking your way.  However, the jump control does not respond when you press it and it just based on pure luck.
Jumping is very essential to the game and why is it broken and unresponsive WTF?  That is plain stupidity on the part of the developers.
This game made me curse a lot and I just probably might go to hell for it.
This game cost Php70.00 in my country which is rather cheap but after playing this awful game the developers should add Php70.00 on my Steam Wallet.
If there was a Top Worst Games List on Steam this would be in the upper-echelon. Putik-ng-inang game ito.

reviewText:
UPDATE: Hard mode beaten.

This is the worst game I have ever played, and given other Unity games I've played lately, that is saying a lot.

There's no storyline to speak of. The voices are in Russian despite picking English, which normally wouldn't be that big of a problem, because there's subtitles. Except...halfway through the game, the majority of the game's subtitles switch to Russian regardless. Maybe the story picks up then? I can't say, I don't speak Russian.

The HUD is obnoxious. It moves with you and is constantly in your way. Your stamina meter depletes ridiculously quickly, and will even deplete if you're attempting to run while caught in a bear trap. There are a ridiculous amount of bear traps in this game by the way.

The jumping mechanics are beyond awful, and you have to go through a very, very long platforming segment. There's a checkpoint about halfway through (but no save point until it's all finished), but it is still brutal.

If you make it through that, you go to another obnoxious laser grid section, and this is followed by actual enemies appearing. You have to pick up a gun nearby (if you can find it) and mow them all down with the worst shooting physics I have ever seen. If an enemy reaches you, you're screwed. It'll bounce you through the air over and over until you're dead, and you can't just aim down at them. On the plus side, they frequently glitch out and get stuck on terrain or dead bodies.

It's difficult to describe what comes after. It's a glitchfest nightmare. At one point you can hop on a train to take you to the end of a long, long tunnel, but if you hit Escape and then resume game it'll propel you infinitely forward to the end of the area where you randomly are given a minigun with infinite ammo to massacre toaster spiders (I'm not kidding). The textures also really start to glitch out around this time badly.

The last area of the game is a maze, and you're on a timer - only the timer doesn't affect anything at all. If it reaches 0, it just counts into the negatives. Whatever.

EDIT: I have now beaten this game on Hard mode. It is frustratingly difficult in all the wrong ways. You get 4 minutes 30 seconds to complete the first laser grid section and the platforming section. If time runs out, you're back to the first laser grid segment. You need to really nail down how the jumping works in this, and trust me, it is not at all intuitive. You'll make it to the end with maybe 20 seconds left. The section after that is annoying, but you've got 5 minutes to do it which is way more than enough. The train section, insultingly, is 10 minutes and 2 seconds. It's stupidly easy.

For those curious, I did not get a 4-letter word upon completing Hard mode (which is supposed to unlock the Mods menu). I assume it must be hidden somewhere in-game, but there's no way I'm going to replay this to find out what it is. What a load of awfulness.

Even closing and loading this game is difficult. I frequently have to Alt+F4 just to get out of it, and about 50% of the time when I load a game the game just hangs. Alt tabbing out will sometimes crash it, and this game causes major slowdown on other applications I have running. The max resolution isn't even 1080p either.

Do not buy this game, even at $2. It's not worth your time or money whatsoever.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Do not buy this game.
By any standards.

I recieved this game for free from an itch.io thing. And I want to refund it for free. Please.

Now of course I could just leave it here but I need to explain why.
The FPS sits on a solid 3. Even on low graphics. Now I could blame my computer but it doesn't take 60 FPS to see this game looks like trash.

The battle isn't even 'Unknown' as it tells you what you're battling 3 seconds into the main menu (which lagged as well).

I died in the first 5 minutes of the game because of the horrible frame rate even though I could clearly see what was ahead.

In conclusion, do not buy Unknown Battle. If you recieve it for free, do not play it. If you play it, review it. Spread the word.

EDIT: When I originally tried to post this, it said I only had 1 minute on record, when I actually played 20. It even stops you from reviewing it.

reviewText:
this game is bad ...
i got past the platform part, which actually was the most interesting part in the whole game ...  BUT you cannot play this with a regular keyboard... i had to switch my keyboard into turbo mode (i have a ducky mechanical keyboard) so your jumps always work and you can take high jumps too which are very necessary...

but the part after the jumps, where the robots come in, it's just totally bullcrap... it's again lasers and traps, and those little robotic spiders hunt you down and you can't do nothing against them... and as soon as they get to you your character loses control, starts to turn around and stuff like that and you just die .. you can't run away from them because you need to go into a room with only one door to deactivate a shield; then those spiders come from the other side of the lasershield where you have to go to... so you need to go into the hall where they are coming from, without any escape possibility... so you re just running into your death... you could try to run back a little through the field of bearclaws and lasers, but they only hit you and the mechaspiders (which are only 1ft high) are not hit by either of those... so that won't help either...

also, at this part of the game something is spoken in russian without english text translation, the text now is russian only too... nice...

this game should not be on steam if you ask me...
it's far from finished... it should contain more of the jumping part and should work without having to enable my turbo mode so any one can enjoy it....  and the lasers/claws need to be a lot less, a hell of a lot less...

reviewText:
Welp,
Got this game free.
Redeemed the key with absolutely no idea what the game was,
Opened it.
Start off in a dark room with lots of little lights.
Walk over to them.
They hurt.
Walk past them.
There we go.

About 5 minutes in to the game, you are faced with floating blocks that you have to jump on to get to the next section. For the life of me, I can't get past it. The controls are so broken it's impossible to get more than half way. You know that bug that a few games have where you can't sprint and jump at the same time? Yeah, that's it. Without sprinting, you can't get far enough, and sprinting, you can't jump.

However, I do think that this game has potential. With a few patches here and there and I think that it'd be pretty good. The only other things I have to complain about are the bad translations. 'Press E - order to open door' and little things like that scattered here and there.
For the low price, I guess I'd reccomend it after the dev fixes the controls. :)

reviewText:
I played this game for one minute.

I went to sleep afterwards.

I woke up in a long forgotten city. The sky was black, infinitely black. No star nor God could pierce through it's shroud.

A gentle wind guided me through the stone streets. Somehow, I knew that epochs have passed without a single soul passing through this place.

I arrived at what passed for a town quarter. A hooded man, wrapped in bandages, sat weeping on the edge of a long dry fountain. Well, I say he was a man. In truth, he was more like what a statue would be if it could speak.

I pressed a magnificent, infinitely faceted diamond into his hands. He gestured for me to lean in, to listen to what he had to say. In a language that I have never heard before, but understood perfectly, he whispered to me.

I know, now. I am Aware.

I have seen beyond the simulacra of this reality. This game is a portal to a place where your name will lose it's meaning.

It's poorly optimized though.

9/10.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Unknown Battle is a game that frustrated me. This game left me angry and annoyed most of the time throughout playing it (Steam did not log all my time in the game for some reason)

Pros:
-To be perfectly honest, I can't find any positive aspects about this game

Cons:
-Mediocre graphics
-Russian dialogue, this is okay, considering there is subtitles, but at a stage the text jumps over to Russian too and you can't change it
-Controls are clunky and unresponsive
-Movement is slower than a tortoise
-FPS issues and a lot of bugs in-game
-Game will crash quite often
-No originality, it's the same traps, same environment, over and over again

It's not worth trying this game. You will just be left frustrated and wishing you could break something
0/10
